results.title: Borneo's cathedral of trees
results.creator_credit: Richard Brock and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: David Attenborough goes in search of wildlife in the Borneo jungle, and finds the world’s largest flower; night creatures such as the tarsier, the slow loris, and the pangolin; and the nomadic Puran tribe who hunt for food using deadly blowpipes. Suitable for upper primary and secondary years 7-12.

results.title: Borneo
results.creator_credit: Colin Baker, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Cinegroup
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Travellers’ guide to the Orient”.
Borneo has long held a fascination for travellers because of the variety of its land forms and the multicultural communities of its population. The video explores the range of islands which make up Borneo, taking us through Sabah (the largest island) then onto Selingaan Island home of wild and beautiful turtles. In Sarawak we explore the fairy-tale palaces of the White Rajahs and take a trip down the Skrang River into the rainforests of Bako. This beautifully shot video is a stimulating introduction to the geography and people of Borneo.

results.title: Born to ride
results.creator_credit: Steve Westh, Catherine Marciniak, Stuart Menzies, Tony Wright and December Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Grey voyagers”.
Mechanic Doug Sunderland has been riding motorbikes for 60 years. At 75 years of age, he sets out on a journey to ride through India and Nepal, overcoming ill-health and a collision to celebrate the new Millennium and 2 million kilometres in the saddle. During his voyage, he recounts the 6 years he spent in an orphanage, suggesting it fueled his desire to seek nature and open spaces. Doug also visits Rumtek Monastery in Sikkim. Cinematography by Catherine Marciniak. Edited by Tony Stevens. Narrated by Anne Phelan.

results.title: Born to boats
results.brief_description: Depicts the British as a people born to boats. Shows designing, process of vuilding, and use of yachts, lifeboats, racing shells, and other small craft. Scenes include yacht-racing at Cowes, Uffa Fox designing new speed-boats including Donald Campbell in his turbo jet boat “Bluebird” with his record breaking run at 204 mph, and rowing on the Thames.

results.title: Born to be small
results.creator_credit: Associated Television, Tony Snowdon and Derek Hart
results.brief_description: Looks at what it is like to be a “little person”, stressing that it is in physical size only that such people differ from others.

results.title: Born spastic
results.creator_credit: National Coal Board and Spastic Society
results.brief_description: Unambiguously, the film explains cerebral palsy and shows various activities of handicapped people in England, including sheltered workshops and social clubs, like Joe’s Club, which caters not only for the handicapped, but their siblings as well. Both the handicapped and the people involved with them discuss some of the problems faced by the handicapped in England.

results.title: Born of fire
results.creator_credit: Linda Reavely, National Geographic Society and WQED
results.brief_description: Although the continents seem stationary, they are actually moving gradually each year. Follow scientists around the world as they search for clues to the causes of volcanic eruptions and earthquakes. The video takes us to Iceland where new and recent volcanoes have emerged, and to Africa, Japan, California and Santorini to record what happens when the “plates” which make up the world’s surface move and crash together.

results.title: Born in fire
results.creator_credit: Shepherd Baker Studios, Woodside Petroleum Ltd and Guy Baskin
results.brief_description: Depicts the final stages of construction, as well as the tow, launch and placement of the substructure for the first offshore production platform for the North West Shelf Project. The aim of the project is to develop a natural gas field to supply power for domestic and industrial use in Perth and southwest Western Australia. Narrated by John Waters. Suitable for secondary years 7-12.

results.title: Born for us
results.creator_credit: Vincenzo Labella, Franco Zeffirelli and Don Bosco Multimedia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Jesus of Nazareth”.
The continuing story of the life of Jesus Christ from: Joseph and Mary’s arrival in Bethlehem; the birth of Jesus; the census in Bethlehem; the gifts of the Magi; Herod’s rage and the killing of the Innocents and the flight to Egypt.

results.title: Born equal
results.creator_credit: Australian Instructional Films and Langton Gould-Marks
results.brief_description: Brief scenes are used to illustrate the meaning and purpose of the United Nations Declaration of Human Rights; that all people should be able to live their own lives as they desire with equality of opportunity, freedom of religion and speech, and with the tolerance of their fellow human beings. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.
